summary: Completed comprehensive testing of PREMIDIS HR Platform new features: Voice Assistant removal, Live Chat implementation, Multi-currency system, and Forgot Password functionality. Backend achieved 100% success rate with all new features working correctly. Frontend testing confirmed successful implementation of most features with one minor issue in salary display.

ui_bugs.issue: Salary shows 'Non défini' (Not defined) even when employee was created with salary and currency

integration_issues.issue: Reset password form elements not visible when token is invalid (expected behavior but form structure should exist)

passed_tests: ✅ Voice Assistant button NOT present on any page (correctly removed)
✅ No 404 errors on /api/voice/* endpoints (endpoints properly removed)
✅ Live Chat tab visible in Communication page (/communication)
✅ Live Chat interface elements (input, send button) working
✅ Can send and receive chat messages successfully
✅ Multi-currency selector (USD/FC) present in employee creation form
✅ Employee creation with USD currency works correctly
✅ Employee creation with FC currency works correctly
✅ Currency field defaults to USD when not specified
✅ Forgot Password page (/forgot-password) accessible and functional
✅ Forgot Password form submission works
✅ Reset Password page (/reset-password?token=xxx) handles invalid tokens correctly
✅ /api/auth/forgot-password endpoint generates tokens (returns 200)
✅ /api/auth/reset-password endpoint validates tokens (returns 400 for invalid)
✅ /api/auth/verify-reset-token endpoint validates tokens correctly
✅ /api/communication/chat/messages endpoint (GET/POST) working
✅ /api/communication/chat/users endpoint (GET) working
✅ Admin and Employee authentication working with provided credentials
✅ Employee creation form includes salary_currency field
✅ Backend properly stores salary with currency (USD/FC)
✅ Backend salary retrieval includes currency information
action_item_for_main_agent: Minor issue: Employee profile salary display shows 'Non défini' instead of the actual salary with currency. This appears to be a frontend display issue as the backend correctly stores and retrieves salary information with currency. All other requested features are working correctly.
